title: Java Level 4 — Arrays & Basic Strings
concept: One-dimensional arrays, traversals, simple string operations.

challenges.name: Array Sum
challenges.description: Given n and an array of n integers, print the sum of all elements.
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Second line: n integers.

challenges.name: Array Maximum
challenges.description: Print the maximum element in the array.
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Second line: n integers.

challenges.name: Count Positives
challenges.description: Count how many elements in the array are strictly positive.
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Second line: n integers.
challenges.output_format: Single integer: count of positive elements.

challenges.name: Array Reverse Print
challenges.description: Given an array, print its elements in reverse order on one line.
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Second line: n integers.
challenges.output_format: n integers in reverse order separated by space.

challenges.name: Linear Search
challenges.description: Given n, array of n integers and a value x, print the index (0-based) of first occurrence of x, or -1 if not found.
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Second line: n integers. Third line: x.

challenges.name: String Length
challenges.description: Given a single line string S (may contain spaces), print its length.

challenges.name: Count Vowels
challenges.description: Given lowercase string S, count the vowels (a, e, i, o, u).

challenges.name: String Reverse
challenges.description: Given string S, print its reverse.

challenges.name: Palindrome String
challenges.description: Check if the given string S is a palindrome. Print YES or NO.
challenges.input_format: Single string S without spaces, case-sensitive.

challenges.name: Count Occurrences in Array
challenges.description: Count how many times x appears in the array.
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Second line: n integers. Third line: x.
